intro: Huttonaea oreophila var. grandiflora, commonly known as the mountain huttonaea, is a flowering plant native to specific high-altitude regions. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces showy, yellow to orange ray flowers. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
